Description: Floor sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup, with turn to stem; glaze fired light orange-brown; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of warrior (helmeted head with added red on crest and added white dots, red breastplate and red shield, in profile, with white striped rim remaining), to right; exterior glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 440-1, no. B720)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p.40, pl. XX, no. 22)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1436) (phase 3)
Brijder 1983a / Siana Cups I and Komast Cups (259, no. 251 and pl. 47d)
